snippet: Previous shows gave the impression everyone would be driving plug-ins by now. But this year in Geneva, the spotlight is on more traditional engines, albeit with an emphasis on emissions and fuel efficiency.
abstract: Geneva auto show spotlights more traditional engines, a contrast to previous years, which focused on electric vehicles that the industry said everyone would soon be driving; emphasis is still on emissions and fuel efficiency, but more rooted in the reality of the wants and needs of consumers.
lead_paragraph: Previous shows gave the impression everyone would be driving plug-ins by now. But this year in Geneva, the spotlight is on more traditional engines, albeit with an emphasis on emissions and fuel efficiency.

headline.main: A More Circumspect View of Electric Cars
headline.print_headline: At Geneva Auto Show, a More Circumspect View of Electric Cars
